Package com.frc5113.library.subsystem.sample

Class FalconTankDrivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
      • com.frc5113.library.subsystem.SmartSubsystem
        • com.frc5113.library.subsystem.sample.FalconTankDrivetrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
    public class FalconTankDrivetrain
extends SmartSubsystem
    A Drivetrain class for a tank drive consisting of two falcons per side

    • Constructor Detail

      • FalconTankDrivetrain

        public FalconTankDrivetrain​(int leftParentId,
                            int rightParentId,
                            int leftChildId,
                            int rightChildId,
                            double deadBand,
                            double rampRate,
                            com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.NeutralMode neutralMode,
                            double gearRatio,
                            double outputDiameter)
        Create tank with custom deadband, rampRate, gear ratio, output diameter parameters.

        Location is based on the forward moving direction of the robot (stand facing the same way the front of the robot is facing)

        Parameters:
        leftParentId - CAN ID of left parent
        rightParentId - CAN ID of right parent
        leftChildId - CAN ID of left child
        rightChildId - CAN ID of right child
        deadBand - Deadband of differential drive
        rampRate - Motor ramp rate
        neutralMode - What to do in neutral mode
        gearRatio - Gear ratio between shaft and output
        outputDiameter - Diameter of the output wheel

      • FalconTankDrivetrain

        public FalconTankDrivetrain​(int leftParentId,
                            int rightParentId,
                            int leftChildId,
                            int rightChildId,
                            double rampRate,
                            com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.NeutralMode neutralMode,
                            double gearRatio,
                            double outputDiameter)
        Create tank with default parameters (deadband = 0.1), but a custom neutral mode, motor ramp rate, gear ratio, output diameter.

        Location is based on the forward moving direction of the robot (stand facing the same way the front of the robot is facing)

        Parameters:
        leftParentId - CAN ID of left parent
        rightParentId - CAN ID of right parent
        leftChildId - CAN ID of left child
        rightChildId - CAN ID of right child
        rampRate - Rate at which motor accelerates
        neutralMode - What to do in neutral mode
        gearRatio - Gear ratio between shaft and output
        outputDiameter - Diameter of the output wheel

      • FalconTankDrivetrain

        public FalconTankDrivetrain​(int leftParentId,
                            int rightParentId,
                            int leftChildId,
                            int rightChildId,
                            com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.NeutralMode neutralMode,
                            double gearRatio,
                            double outputDiameter)
        Create tank with default parameters (deadband = 0.1, ramp_rate = 0.1), but a custom neutral mode, gear ratio, output diameter.

        Location is based on the forward moving direction of the robot (stand facing the same way the front of the robot is facing)

        Parameters:
        leftParentId - CAN ID of left parent
        rightParentId - CAN ID of right parent
        leftChildId - CAN ID of left child
        rightChildId - CAN ID of right child
        neutralMode - What to do in neutral mode
        gearRatio - Gear ratio between shaft and output
        outputDiameter - Diameter of the output wheel

      • FalconTankDrivetrain

        public FalconTankDrivetrain​(int leftParentId,
                            int rightParentId,
                            int leftChildId,
                            int rightChildId,
                            double gearRatio,
                            double outputDiameter)
        Create tank with default parameters (deadband = 0.1, ramp_rate = 0.1, neutral_mode = coast).

        Location is based on the forward moving direction of the robot (stand facing the same way the front of the robot is facing)

        Parameters:
        leftParentId - CAN ID of left parent
        rightParentId - CAN ID of right parent
        leftChildId - CAN ID of left child
        rightChildId - CAN ID of right child
        gearRatio - Gear ratio between shaft and output
        outputDiameter - Diameter of the output wheel

      • FalconTankDrivetrain

        public FalconTankDrivetrain​(int leftParentId,
                            int rightParentId,
                            int leftChildId,
                            int rightChildId)
        Create tank with default parameters (deadband = 0.1, ramp_rate = 0.1, neutral_mode = coast, gear_ratio = 1, output_diameter = 1).

        Location is based on the forward moving direction of the robot (stand facing the same way the front of the robot is facing)

        Parameters:
        leftParentId - CAN ID of left parent
        rightParentId - CAN ID of right parent
        leftChildId - CAN ID of left child
        rightChildId - CAN ID of right child

    • Method Detail

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive​(double leftSpeed,
                      double rightSpeed)
        Drive the left and right side at custom speeds 0-1.

        Location is based on the forward moving direction of the robot (stand facing the same way the front of the robot is facing)

        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - Speed of the left side [0.0, 1.0]
        rightSpeed - Speed of the right side [0.0, 1.0]

      • tankDriveVolts

        public void tankDriveVolts​(double leftSpeed,
                           double rightSpeed)
        Drive the left and right side at custom speeds 0-1, but using voltage control. NOT set it and forget it, must be updated.

        Location is based on the forward moving direction of the robot (stand facing the same way the front of the robot is facing)

        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - Speed of the left side [0.0, 1.0]
        rightSpeed - Speed of the right side [0.0, 1.0]

      • tankDrivePureVolts

        public void tankDrivePureVolts​(double leftSpeed,
                               double rightSpeed)
        Drive the left and right side using voltage control. NOT set it and forget it, must be updated.

        Location is based on the forward moving direction of the robot (stand facing the same way the front of the robot is facing)

        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - Speed of the left side [0.0, ~12.4]
        rightSpeed - Speed of the right side [0.0, ~12.4]

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive​(double speed,
                        double rotation)
        Arcade drive (speed and turn). The calculated values will be squared to decrease sensitivity at low speeds.
        Parameters:
        speed - The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0, 1.0]. Forward is positive.
        rotation - The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0, 1.0]. Clockwise is positive.

      • curvatureDrive

        public void curvatureDrive​(double speed,
                           double rotation)
        Curvature drive method for differential drive platform.

        The rotation argument controls the curvature of the robot's path rather than its rate of heading change. This makes the robot more controllable at high speeds.

        This version turns in place only at low speeds, shouldn't be an issue

        Parameters:
        speed - The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
        rotation - The normalized curvature [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is positive.

      • curvatureDrive

        public void curvatureDrive​(double speed,
                           double rotation,
                           boolean inPlaceTurns)
        Curvature drive method for differential drive platform.

        The rotation argument controls the curvature of the robot's path rather than its rate of heading change. This makes the robot more controllable at high speeds.

        Parameters:
        speed - The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
        rotation - The normalized curvature [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is positive.
        inPlaceTurns - Turn in place? (should be a yes)

      • triggerDrive

        public void triggerDrive​(double forward,
                         double reverse,
                         double rotation)
        Arcade drive (speed and turn), but the speed is controlled by two triggers (forward and backward - where the speed is forward - backward). The calculated values will be squared to decrease sensitivity at low speeds.
        Parameters:
        forward - The robot's speed along the X axis [0, 1.0]. Moves robot forward by this amount.
        reverse - The robot's speed along the X axis [0, 1.0]. Moves robot backward by this amount.
        rotation - The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0, 1.0]. Clockwise is positive.

      • setMaxOutput

        public void setMaxOutput​(double max)
        Set the max output of the motors on the drivetrain (useful for a global limiter)
        Parameters:
        max - Multiplied with the output percentage computed by the drive functions.

        public void motorTest​(TankMotorSelector motor)
        Check if a motors works
        Parameters:
        motor - Motor to test on a tank drive (format TankMotorSelector)
